page.title: 04Torridon Primary School
page.content: There is only one{Primary School}in Torridon.At present there are eight pupils and one teacher.There are two travelling teachers,one for Gaelic and one for music,who come once a week.All the other subjects are taught by the head teacher.The school is at least 90 years old.There is only one room for the school and one for the canteen in which lunches are cooked and served. There used to be no canteen and that room was another classroom. The school was then like a primary and secondary combined,so most pupils did not go to an other school,but left from Torridon Public School as it was then called. Some more able scholars went for higher education to Dingwall Academy. Pupils attend from a wide area, most being brought by school transport. Stages are from P1 to P7,after which the pupils attend Plockton High School
